001package edu.cnm.deepdive.uno.adapter;
002
003import android.content.Context;
004import android.view.LayoutInflater;
005import android.view.ViewGroup;
006import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
007import androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView;
008import androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder;
009import edu.cnm.deepdive.uno.databinding.ItemUserBinding;
010import edu.cnm.deepdive.uno.model.domain.Hand;
011import edu.cnm.deepdive.uno.model.domain.User;
012import java.util.List;
013
014public class UsersAdapter extends RecyclerView.Adapter<ViewHolder> {
015
016  private final List<Hand> hands;
017  private final LayoutInflater layoutInflater;
018
019  /**
020   * Constructs a new UsersAdapter instance.
021   *
022   * @param context The context in which the adapter is running, used for layout inflation.
023   * @param hands   A list of Hand objects representing the hands to be managed by the adapter.
024   */
025  public UsersAdapter(Context context, List<Hand> hands) {
026    this.hands = hands;
027    this.layoutInflater = LayoutInflater.from(context);
028  }
029
030  @NonNull
031  @Override
032  public ViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(@NonNull ViewGroup parent, int viewType) {
033    return new UserViewHolder(ItemUserBinding.inflate(layoutInflater, parent, false));
034  }
035
036  @Override
037  public void onBindViewHolder(@NonNull ViewHolder holder, int position) {
038    Hand hand = hands.get(position);
039    ((UserViewHolder) holder).bind(hand);
040  }
041
042  @Override
043  public int getItemCount() {
044    return hands.size();
045  }
046
047  private class UserViewHolder extends RecyclerView.ViewHolder {
048
049    private final ItemUserBinding binding;
050
051    /**
052     * ViewHolder for displaying user information in the UsersAdapter.
053     *
054     * <p>This constructor initializes the ViewHolder with the specified ItemUserBinding and sets the root view for the ViewHolder.</p>
055     *
056     * @param binding The {@link ItemUserBinding} instance that provides access to the user item layout views.
057     */
058    public UserViewHolder(ItemUserBinding binding) {
059      super(binding.getRoot());
060      this.binding = binding;
061    }
062
063    /**
064     * Binds the specified Hand data to the ViewHolder's views.
065     *
066     * <p>This method updates the user display name and the number of cards for the specified hand in the user item layout.</p>
067     *
068     * @param hand The Hand object containing the user data to be displayed.
069     */
070    public void bind(Hand hand) {
071      binding.userDisplayName.setText(hand.getUser().getDisplayName());
072      String numberOfCards = String.valueOf(hand.getNumberOfCards());
073      binding.userCardCount.setText(numberOfCards);
074    }
075  }
076}
